definitions.description:
A Ledger Account is a separate record that is maintained for each category of asset, liability, permanent and temporary capital record.

It is an individual accounting record of increases and decreases in specific asset, liability, and stockholders' equity items.

The purpose of the account is to record the information about each business transaction.

Note:
There can be more than one Chart of Accounts.
